Key Match Events: LeBron James scored eleven straight points as part of the team's 21-0 run against the Kings.
LeBron James ended the night with a triple-double featuring 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists.
LeBron James went 6-6 from the field, 3-3 from 3-point range, and knocked down his sole free throw in the final frame.
Anthony Davis hit a crucial 3-pointer after a pass from LeBron James, giving the Lakers some breathing room.
LeBron James handled the inbound and fed the ball to Anthony Davis, who was fouled with 10.6 seconds left.
Anthony Davis made one of his two free throws to essentially end the game, giving Los Angeles their first 3-0 start since the 2010-11 season.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers coach JJ Redick gushed over LeBron James, stating, 'We've all been very fortunate to watch his greatness for so long and the fact that he's able to keep doing it, it's just… it's actually insane.'
